name: kenaf production, irrigated | kenaf plant, harvested | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19818/documentation

The inventory covers field activity for production of 1 kg kenaf plant. The farm has a yield of 30,000 kg fresh green matter per ha for this crop cycle. Mineral NPK fertilizer input is 80-40-40 kg/ha.;;Kenaf (commonly known as mesta) is an annual or biennial herbaceous plant. The fibres in kenaf are found in the bast (bark) and core (wood). The bast constitutes 40% and core constitutes 60% of the plant. The bast fibres are long (2 to 6 mm) and slender while core has thick (ø 38 µm) but short (0.5 mm) and thin walled (3µm) fibres. Unlike jute, kenaf requires less care in its cultivation and takes a longer time to mature. The plant is harvested for retting when in full flower stage.

This activity starts right after the harvest of the previous crop. The soil is prepared for the kenaf cultivation.

The activity ends at the harvesting of the mature kenaf plant.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0116:Growing of fibre crops

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Sowing date for main crop-15 March 2016; harvesting date of main crop:-15 September 2016. Total harvesting time from the date of sowing is around 150 days. Data is for one crop cycle. Cycle of one year considered for entry in ecoeditor
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Cultivation of kenaf from conventional production standards
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The data on inputs to the field activites are collected directly from the farmers and farming experts. However, the emission data were not readily available for India. Hence, Ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production was used to calculate field emissions from the cultivation process.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Focus group discussion, expert interviews, literature data and assumptions. Standardized questionnaires were developed and adapted to jute-specific cultivation and post-harvest situation. The secondary data from literature and the primary data from surveys were compared and matched to obtain highest data quality.

exchanges.description: Calculated Value. This value has been calculated by using the Ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production.

Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'kenaf plant, harvested' is calculated to be circa 5.33E-03 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'ammonia, liquid', 'ammonium nitrate, as N', 'ammonium sulfate, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'phosphate rock, as P2O5, beneficiated, dry', 'potassium chloride, as K2O', 'potassium fertiliser, as K2O', 'potassium sulfate, as K2O', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 1.07E-02 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.
